definition: to have had enough of/to be fed up with/to have had one's fill of
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
enough (sufficient)/enough (too much)/(coll.) (before adj.) really/(coll.) to reach by stretching out

sentences.english: I've had enough of your tootle.
sentences.chinese: 我已經受夠你的嘮叨了。

sentences.english: She was totally fed up. There was too much attention on her for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 她是完全受夠了，沒有任何理由對她有那麼多的關注。

sentences.english: I've just about had enough of your unpunctuality .
sentences.chinese: 你的不準時讓我受夠了。

sentences.english: I've had enough of the noisiness here.
Their leadership knew people were fed up of Mao style leadership.
sentences.chinese: 他們的領導知道人們受夠了毛式領導風格。

sentences.english: He was really getting tired of the catcalls and the manhandling.
sentences.chinese: 他真是受夠那些噓聲和毛毛躁躁的騷擾了。

sentences.english: Mr Yang would like more but his wife has had enough.
sentences.chinese: 楊先生還想再要但是他的妻子卻受夠了。

sentences.english: I am fed up with my sister's hand-me-downs.
sentences.chinese: 我受夠了穿我姐姐的舊衣服。

sentences.english: I would not question his heart now. He was wrecked by this loss.
sentences.chinese: 我不質疑他的心理了，他已經受夠打擊了。

sentences.english: He got enough of that kind of treatment from Mom.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的待遇，他從老媽那裏已經受夠了。

sentences.english: I've just about had enough of his stupidities.
sentences.chinese: 對他的愚蠢我有點受夠了。

sentences.english: Under the weight of these heavy manners, let the power fall.
sentences.chinese: 受夠了那些沉甸甸的重壓，打倒當權派。

sentences.english: I've had enough of him constantly carping and criticizing.
sentences.chinese: 我已經受夠了他不斷地喫毛求疵和批評。

sentences.english: Enough, already with this mellow incense and peppermints vibe.
sentences.chinese: 夠了，我受夠這些薰香以及薄荷的感覺了。

sentences.english: I'm so fed up with the bland food.
sentences.chinese: 我受夠了那些乏味的食物了。

sentences.english: Girls get fed up with the feminine nature of the men.
sentences.chinese: 女孩兒們更是受夠了那些陰柔的娘娘腔。

definition: more than one can bear (idiom); at the end of one's patience/the last straw
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
to enumerate sb's shortcomings/to criticize/to scold/to talk on and on
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
